text.section:
During any period in which an employee of the employer is entitled to a wage rate under this title, each employer subject to this title shall post in a prominent and easily accessible place at the work site of an employee described in § 18-102(a) of this title a notice of:
the living wage rate;
employee rights under this title; and
the name, address, and telephone number of the Commissioner.

The notice under this section shall be:
developed by the Commissioner in English, Spanish, and any other language commonly used by employees at a work site; and
on request of an employer, provided without charge to the employer; or
made available for download on the Internet without charge.
Subject to § 10-1001 of the State Government Article, the Commissioner may impose on a person that violates this section a civil penalty not exceeding $50 per violation.
